result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jean R Shea

records.addlTxt: received and filed.

Defendant Jean R Shea appeared by video.  Attorney Helmi Hamad appeared by video for Jean R Shea.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant to enter into DTC on November 9th, 2022 at 3:15 AM. Case to remain on the calendar for entry into DTC. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
DPA Supervision Report, received and filed

Defendant Jean R Shea not in court.  Attorney Dawn Rablin appeared in court on behalf of Helmi Hamad for Jean R Shea.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Review Hearing. Defense counsel provides an update to the court regarding the defendant. Defendant's appearance has been waived for the purpose of today's hearing. Case adjourned for an additional review hearing to Br 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 10.18.22

Defendant Jean R Shea in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Jean R Shea.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant not compliant with the terms of the agreement. Statements made by victim; TM. Arguments heard from parties as to possible sanctions. Due to defendants noncompliance with the terms of the DPA, the Court is IMPOSING AND STAYING a 3 day jail sanction. Court orders the defendant to report to First Step Recovery Center on today's date for detox. Court orders the defendant to contact the defendant's JusticePoint case manager to work on apply for residential treatment no later then tomorrow. Court also orders the defendant to report for residential treatment as soon as a bed becomes available. Court orders defendant to attend all of the required drug testing and provide a usable sample. Defense reports that defendant is interested in participating in DTC. Case needs to be staffed. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 10.10.22
Received and Filed. DPA Violation 10.7.22

Defendant Jean R Shea in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Jean R Shea.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant needs to complete community service hours and apology letter. Defendant needs to complete the letter of the apology and the community service hours by the next court date in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Received and Filed. DPA SUPERVISION REPORT 9-2-22

Defendant Jean R Shea in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in receipt of a JusticePoint violation. Court issues a verbal admonishment to the defendant. Case adjourned to Branch 17 for a review hearing on September 6th, 2022 at 2:50 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Violation 8.4.22
Court in receipt of a JusticePoint violation report. Court scheduled hearing with parties to address violation via email correspondence. Court scheduled hearing for August 8th, 2022 at 10:40 am.

Defendant Jean R Shea in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Victim is also here in person. 
Report reviewed. Defendant attended 4 out of 7 office contacts. Defendant needs to complete community service and letter of apology. Defendant completed 'T4C'. Defendant needs to test negative in order to receive the benefit of this agreement. Victim makes statement.   Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Review Hearing.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:50 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 7.22.22
Received and Filed. DPA Violation Report 7.21.22

Defendant Jean R Shea in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Mid Point Review. Report reviewed. Defendant attended 10 out of 11 office contacts. Defendant needs community service and letter of apology. Defendant is attending 'T4C'. Court COMMENDS the defendant on her treatment choices. Defendant needs to test negative in order to receive the benefit of this agreement. Victim speaks. Court reminds the defendant of the no violent contact order. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Review Hearing in Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 6.6.22

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Jean R Shea in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jean R Shea appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom.  Defendant waives In Person appearance; Matter live streamed on Dacast.
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea Form
Received and Filed, Elements
Received and Filed, DPA  Agreement
